meanings.definition: The act of making a loud, deep sound like a lion.
meanings.sent1: The roarings of the lion echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The zoo was filled with the roarings of various animals.
meanings.sent3: The roarings of the lion scared the little monkey.
meanings.sent4: The roarings of the storm were deafening.
meanings.sent5: The roarings of the lion were as fierce as thunder.

meanings.definition: A loud, deep sound like that of a lion.
meanings.sent1: The roarings of the engine could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The roarings of the crowd at the concert were exhilarating.
meanings.sent3: The roarings of the wind made the trees dance.
meanings.sent4: The roarings of the waterfall drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The roarings of the lion were mimicked by the thunderstorm.

meanings.sent1: The roarings of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent2: The roarings of the train passing by were heard in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The roarings of the old pipes kept the house awake at night.
meanings.sent4: The roarings of the ocean waves were calming to the sailor.
meanings.sent5: The roarings of the crowd filled the stadium with energy.
